page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT CHELWOOD GATE
page.content:
{BIOGRAPHY}(continued) lishing 1963-67. 1960 Chancellor of Oxford University.
{EMPLOYMENT IN CHELWOOD GATE It is estimated that one in three people work in the village itself, full or part time, in local shops - grocers, hairdresser, hardware/cycle, saddlery & animal foods, post office - pubs, hotel, farms, garages, builders, old people's home, nursing home and houses. Others work in the vicinity at the brick works, dairy and sawmill etc. The rest commute to varying types of employment to Crawley, Gatwick Air- port, Haywards Heath, East Grinstead, Crowborough, Uckfield etc. and London and Brighton.
